The Calumet Penreco facility, located in Karns City, Pennsylvania handles one chemical above the threshold quantity listed in the Risk Management Plan regulation.  Specifically, oleum is stored in an aboveground storage tank above the threshold quantity.

The worst-case scenario is determined to be a failure of the oleum aboveground storage tank.  Since the facility is only an RMP Program Level 1, an alternate release scenario was not required or developed.  Mitigation measures to control the release include a concrete dike six feet in height that would be capable of containing > 100% of the volume of the storage tank.  Further, the tank is located approximately in the geographic center of the Calumet Penreco facility (not at the property border).  Calumet Penreco is prepared to handle a worst-case release by training its emergency responders in Hazwoper Level 3, 40 CFR, Section 1910.120.

Prevention steps include a strict inspection schedule, the implementation of numerous procedures, and carefully observing Process Safety Management guidelines.

There have been no accidents at Calumet Penreco in the past five years involving the regulated substance that meet the criteria outlined in 40 CFR, Part 68.42.

A comprehensive emergency response program/plan has been developed and is regularly used to train both in-house and local area responders.
